Description: Mould-made brown pottery lamp, decorated on the discus with a bear. Air-hole. Raised base; curved mouldmark. Light-brown clay, with some mica, covered in dark brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1895)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (584)
Haken 1958 / Roman Lamps in the Prague National Museum (p.53)
Ozoil 1977 / Les Lamps du Musée de Chypre (357)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
